name: Settle & Carlisle Day Ranger
description:
SETTLE & CARLISLE DAY RANGER Unlimited travel for one day between Leeds/Bradford Forster Square and Carlisle. As well as the scenic splendour and the market towns of Settle, Kirkby Stephen and Appleby 
      this ranger also gives access to the Yorkshire Dales and the stations of Horton-in-Ribblesdale, Ribblehead, Dent and Garsdale.

fares_and_restrictions.raw: fares & restrictions New fares from 2nd Mar 2025 One day ranger adult: £40.80 child (5-15): £20.40 16-17 saver: £20.40 railcards ⯆ 16 26 SE DI 2T FF H V DA : £27.15 FF H V DA child fare: £7.75 Railcards ⯈ Railcards: 16 = 16-25 26 = 26-30 SE = Senior DI = Disabled 2T = Two Together FF = Family & Friends H = HM Forces V = Veterans DA = Dales Railcard Previous fares ⯈ Previous fares (adult): 2024 - £39.00 2023 - £37.10 2022 - £35.00 2021 - £32.80 2020 - £32.80 2019 - £31.90 2018 - £31.00 time restrictions Valid anytime but 2T railcard not valid until 09:30 train operating companies Northern purchasing Online: X Train conductor: ✔ * Station ticket office: ✔ Ticket Vending Machine: i Northern Ticket Vending Machines now sell most ranger and rover tickets but at the moment only for same-day travel (rather prohibitive for distant areas) Some Avanti West Coast station TVMs for example Crewe, now sell local rangers and rovers. LNER TVMs at Doncaster, Edinburgh, London King's Cross, Newcastle and York also sell them. A number of PTE areas sell local rangers from TVMs in their area e.g. South Yorkshire, Strathclyde and West Midlands * valid ticket to travel is required unless boarded at a station without ticket-issuing facilities
